title: Chelsea fans can breathe a sigh of relief over Diego Costa controversy
text:
Chelsea fans can breathe a sigh of relief over Diego Costa controversy By James on Tuesday, January 17, 2017 Peace at Chelsea 
Tuesday brings good news for Chelsea fans sweating under the intense light of controversy at the club. Tutto Mercato Web exclusively reports that Antonio Conte and Diego Costa have made peace. They don’t go into too much detail about this but confirm that he’ll be back in the team this weekend. 
Chelsea host Hull City at Stamford Bridge on Sunday. Costa checks his cards 
The Blues got on just fine without their star striker when they travelled to Leicester on Saturday. Marcos Alonso stepped up to the plate in the Spain international’s absence. He bagged a brace and came close to getting a hat-trick – not bad for a wing-back. Pedro got the other goal in a very comfortable 3-0 stroll. 
Perhaps it made Costa review his hand. 
Antonio Conte refused to relent to player power by approaching Costa first. The argument was started by the forward and if it was to have a happy ending, it would be up to Costa too. Now Chelsea can concentrate on their title bid again. Loading tags...
